a2

Class FileCopier

  • java.lang.Object
    • a2.Command
      • a2.FileCopier
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileMover

    public class FileCopier
extends Command
    This class contains various methods for copying files, as well as various methods locating and identifying files within a given file system
    Author:
    Steven

    • Method Detail

      • getDocumentation

        public static java.lang.String getDocumentation()

      • copy

        public static void copy(Directory workingDirectory,
        java.lang.String oldPath,
        java.lang.String newPath)
        Copies the file at oldPath to newPath. If oldPath is a directory, then all of oldPath's contents are copied into newPath. (Assumes that the arguments passed on to the method are valid)
        Parameters:
        workingDirectory - The current working directory
        oldPath - The path for the item that gets copied
        newPath - The path for the directory that the item gets copied to

      • copyFile

        public static void copyFile(java.lang.String oldFileName,
            java.lang.String newFileName,
            Directory oldDir,
            Directory newDir)
        Copies a given file from oldDir to a newDir, with the new file having the name newFileName.
        Parameters:
        oldFileName - The name of the file that gets copied
        newFileName - The name of the new file that gets created
        oldDir - The directory that the old file resides in
        newDir - The directory that the file gets copied to

      • findFile

        public static File findFile(Directory d,
            java.lang.String fileName)
        Retrieves a file if it resides in the given directory.
        Parameters:
        d - The directory that the given file is supposed to reside in
        fileName - The name of the file that is to be found
        Returns:
        The actual File with the fileName if it exists, null otherwise.

      • dirExists

        public static boolean dirExists(java.lang.String path,
                Directory currentDir)
        Checks to see if a given directory with a path (relative to the current directory) exists or not
        Parameters:
        path - The path of the given directory (relative to the current directory)
        currentDir - The Directory object that represents the current directory
        Returns:
        TRUE if the given directory exists, FALSE otherwise

      • getNameFromPath

        public static java.lang.String getNameFromPath(java.lang.String path)
        Gets the file name that is found at the end of a given path
        Parameters:
        path - The path for either a directory or a file
        Returns:
        An empty string if path denotes a director, otherwise the name of the file denoted by path is returned.
